problem.prob_desc:
24. 타원 $\dfrac{x^2}{a^2}+\dfrac{y^2}{6}=1$ 위의 점 $(\sqrt{3}, -2)$에서의 접선의 기울기는? (단, $a$는 양수이다.) [3점]
① $\sqrt{3}$ ② $\dfrac{\sqrt{3}}{2}$ ③ $\dfrac{\sqrt{3}}{3}$ ④ $\dfrac{\sqrt{3}}{4}$ ⑤ $\dfrac{\sqrt{3}}{5}$

gpt-5-codex.title: Differentiate and evaluate slope
gpt-5-codex.body: Implicitly differentiate x²/a² + y²/6 = 1: 2x/a² + (y/3)·y′ = 0 ⇒ y′ = −(6x)/(a²y). Substitute a² = 9 and (x, y) = (√3, −2): y′ = −(6√3)/(9·(−2)) = √3/3.

gpt-5.title: Find a from point on ellipse

claude-opus-4.5.title: Find the value of a² using the point on ellipse
claude-opus-4.5.body:
The point (√3, -2) lies on the ellipse x²/a² + y²/6 = 1.
Substituting: (√3)²/a² + (-2)²/6 = 1
3/a² + 4/6 = 1
3/a² + 2/3 = 1
3/a² = 1 - 2/3 = 1/3
a² = 9

claude-opus-4.5.title: Find the slope using implicit differentiation
claude-opus-4.5.body:
The ellipse equation is: x²/9 + y²/6 = 1
Differentiating implicitly with respect to x:
2x/9 + 2y·(dy/dx)/6 = 0
2x/9 + y·(dy/dx)/3 = 0
Solving for dy/dx:
y·(dy/dx)/3 = -2x/9
dy/dx = -2x/9 · 3/y = -2x/(3y)

claude-opus-4.5.title: Calculate the slope at the given point

gemini-3-pro.title: Determine the value of the constant a²
gemini-3-pro.body:
Since the point $(\sqrt{3}, -2)$ lies on the ellipse $\frac{x^2}{a^2} + \frac{y^2}{6} = 1$, we substitute the coordinates $x = \sqrt{3}$ and $y = -2$ into the equation:

$$ \frac{(\sqrt{3})^2}{a^2} + \frac{(-2)^2}{6} = 1 $$
$$ \frac{3}{a^2} + \frac{4}{6} = 1 $$

Simplify the fraction $\frac{4}{6}$ to $\frac{2}{3}$:
$$ \frac{3}{a^2} + \frac{2}{3} = 1 $$
$$ \frac{3}{a^2} = 1 - \frac{2}{3} $$
$$ \frac{3}{a^2} = \frac{1}{3} $$

Solving for $a^2$:
$$ a^2 = 9 $$

gemini-3-pro.title: Calculate the slope of the tangent line
gemini-3-pro.body:
Using the formula for the tangent line to an ellipse $\frac{x^2}{a^2} + \frac{y^2}{b^2} = 1$ at a point $(x_1, y_1)$, which is $\frac{x_1 x}{a^2} + \frac{y_1 y}{b^2} = 1$, we substitute $a^2 = 9$, $b^2 = 6$, $x_1 = \sqrt{3}$, and $y_1 = -2$:

$$ \frac{\sqrt{3}x}{9} + \frac{-2y}{6} = 1 $$
$$ \frac{\sqrt{3}}{9}x - \frac{1}{3}y = 1 $$

To find the slope, we rearrange the equation into the form $y = mx + c$:
$$ \frac{1}{3}y = \frac{\sqrt{3}}{9}x - 1 $$
Multiply both sides by 3:
$$ y = \frac{3\sqrt{3}}{9}x - 3 $$
$$ y = \frac{\sqrt{3}}{3}x - 3 $$

The slope of the tangent line is the coefficient of $x$, which is $\frac{\sqrt{3}}{3}$.

grok-4-fast.title: Implicit differentiation
grok-4-fast.body: Differentiate the ellipse equation implicitly: \[\frac{x^2}{a^2} + \frac{y^2}{6} = 1\] \[\frac{2x}{a^2} + \frac{2y}{6} \frac{dy}{dx} = 0\] \[\frac{dy}{dx} = -\frac{x \cdot 6}{y \cdot a^2} \cdot \frac{a^2}{a^2} wait, simplify properly: \] from \[\frac{2x}{a^2} + \frac{2y y'}{6} = 0\] \[y' = -\frac{x / a^2}{y / 6} = -\frac{6x}{a^2 y}\]
